analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The reverse order of the dependent origination, the text of the Paṭṭhāna according to the Triad method

original: 22.17. Vedanāttika, Hetuduka🔽Nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto🔽hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasukhāya
analyzed: na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam na hetum dhammam paṭicca sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ  hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam na hetum dhamma  paṭicca dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na sukhāya
translated: The Section on Feeling, the Second Chapter

original: vedanāya sampayuttaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto🔽hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: vedanāya sampayuttam na hetum dhammam paṭicca adukkham asukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ 🔽hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi 🔽na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam na hetum dhammam paṭicca dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a state that is not related to pleasure and that is not a root-cause as condition there arises a state that is related to pleasure and is a root-cause. With a state that is not related to pleasure and that is not a root-cause as condition there arises a state that is related to pain and is a root-cause. With a state that is not related to pleasure and that is not a root-cause as condition there arises a state that is related to neither pleasure nor pain and is a root-cause. With a state that is not related to pain and that is not a root-cause as condition there arises a state that is related to pleasure and is a root-cause. With a state that is not related to pain and that is not a root-cause as condition there arises a state that is related to pain and is a root-cause. With a state that is not related to pain and that is not a root-cause as condition there arises a state that is related to neither pleasure nor pain and is a root-cause.

original: Naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam na hetum dhammam paṭicca adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a non-root-cause dhamma associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling as condition there arises a root-cause dhamma associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling … (three triplets).

original: Nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ nahetuñca naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ🔽nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā
analyzed: na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam na hetuñca na adukkham asukhāya vedanāya sampayutta  na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a non-root-cause dhamma associated with pleasant feeling and a non-root-cause dhamma associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling …

original: … tīṇi. (Dutiyaṁ gaṇitakena tīṇi.) Hetuyā ekavīsa …pe… vipāke cuddasa …pe… avigate ekavīsa.
analyzed: tīṇi dutiyam gaṇitakena tīṇi hetuyāḥ ekavīsa pe vipāke cuddasa pe avigate ekavīsa
translated: With a non-root-cause dhamma associated with pleasant feeling as condition, a root-cause dhamma associated with pleasant feeling arises … (The second triad is the same as the first.) … With a root-cause dhamma as condition, a root-cause dhamma … (twenty-one). … With a root-cause dhamma as condition, an effect not to be abandoned … (fourteen). … With an effect not to be abandoned as condition, an effect not to be abandoned … (fourteen). … With an effect not to be abandoned as condition, a root-cause … (fourteen). … With a root-cause and an effect not to be abandoned as condition, a root-cause … (fourteen). … With a root-cause and an effect not to be abandoned as condition, an effect not to be abandoned … (fourteen). … With a root-cause and an effect not to be abandoned as condition, a root-cause and an effect not to be abandoned … (seven).🔽With a non-root-cause dhamma associated with pleasant feeling as condition, a non-root-cause dhamma associated with painful feeling arises … (two).

original: Nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ nanahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … dve.🔽Nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ nanahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …. (Dve pañhāyeva.)
analyzed: na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam na na hetum dhammam paṭicca dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā dve 🔽na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam na na hetum dhammam paṭicca dve pañhāya eva
translated: With a non-root-cause dhamma associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling as condition … (two questions).

original: Naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ nanahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …. Hetuyā nava …pe… vipāke cha …pe… avigate nava.
